content.title: Incentive Scheme for MSMEs in Powerloom Sector: Subsidy for Standard Quality Compliance
content.beneficiary: Micro, small and medium enterprises in the powerloom sector
content.details: The scheme provides subsidies for enterprises in the powerloom sector that comply with standard quality requirements, aimed at promoting production and quality in the industry.
benefits: Financial assistance for compliance with quality standards
Support for capital investment in new machinery
eligibility: Enterprises must be micro, small, or medium enterprises in the powerloom sector
Production must have started on or after January 1, 2022
A Four-party agreement must be executed between the enterprise, Tantuja, Directorate of Textiles & Financial institution
content.application_process: Enterprises need to apply for the subsidy along with the required documents to the designated authorities as per the guidelines provided by the concerned department or agency.

faqs.question: What areas are classified under 'Zone A' for the purpose of determining incentives?
faqs.answer: 'Zone A' includes Kolkata Municipal Corporation Area, All municipal areas of North 24-Parganas, All municipal areas of South 24-Parganas, All municipal Corporation and municipal areas of Howrah.

faqs.question: Which districts fall under 'Zone B' for incentive classification?
faqs.answer: 'Zone B' comprises Districts of Hooghly, North 24 Parganas (excluding municipal areas and Sundarban areas), South 24 Parganas (excluding municipal areas and Sundarban areas), Howrah (excluding corporation and municipal areas), Siliguri Municipal Corporation, Municipal Corporations / Municipal Areas of Paschim Medinipur, Purba Medinipur, Purba Bardhaman, Paschim Bardhaman and Nadia.

faqs.question: What is the primary eligibility criteria for incentives under the 'Incentive Scheme for MSMEs in Powerloom Sector'?
faqs.answer: The scheme shall generally be applicable to all micro, small and medium enterprises in the powerloom sector which have started production on or after 1st day of January, 2022 and have executed a Four-party agreement.

faqs.question: What information must be included on a certification certificate to ensure it meets all necessary requirements?
faqs.answer: The certificate must have the name & address of the certification agency, address of the site/location certified; scope of certification, certificate number, date of issue and period of validity, Name and Logo & Number of the accreditation board (NABCD).

faqs.question: How does the Directorate of Textile scrutinize and conduct physical inspection of the enterprise upon receiving its application for incentives?
faqs.answer: On receipt of application for incentive from an enterprise, the Directorate of Textile shall make scrutiny of particulars furnished by the enterprise and cause physical inspection of the enterprise through the Officers of the Directorate.

faqs.question: How is the Capital Investment Subsidy released by the Directorate of Textiles to the Bank/FI?
faqs.answer: Capital Investment Subsidy will be released by Directorate of Textiles to the Bank/FI in advance as per requisition placed by the bank against the invoice of the purchase order produced by the enterprise.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for claiming the Subsidy?
faqs.answer: Enterprises need to apply for the subsidy along with the required documents to the designated authorities as per the guidelines provided.

faqs.question: What is the significance of the classification of areas into different zones for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The classification helps in determining the quantum of incentives available for projects based on their location.

faqs.question: Would an eligible enterprise that has availed of incentives or subsidies under any other state government incentive scheme be eligible for benefits under the Incentive Scheme for MSMEs in the Powerloom Sector?
faqs.answer: Yes, an eligible enterprise which has availed of incentive/subsidy in respect of any of the items specified under any other Incentive of State Govt. shall also be eligible to get the benefits of other items.

faqs.question: How does the Directorate of Textiles determine the eligibility of enterprises for projects financed from their own resources?
faqs.answer: Eligibility of the enterprise shall be considered by the Directorate of Textiles according to the declaration of the enterprise regarding source of finance.

faqs.question: What is an 'Approved project'?
faqs.answer: 'Approved Project' means the industrial project of a unit in the Powerloom sector which should be approved before implementation.

faqs.question: What measures are in place to prevent misuse of the subsidy scheme?
faqs.answer: Strict guidelines, documentation requirements, and verification procedures are in place to ensure that subsidies are availed by eligible enterprises.

faqs.question: What action will the Directorate of Textile take if an application is determined to be ineligible for incentives?
faqs.answer: If any application is found to be not eligible, Directorate of Textile will issue a letter of rejection to the applicant enterprise.
